explanation: The loop 'for i in range(n):' allows i to reach values where s[l+i] (with l up to 6) goes past the end of the list and causes an IndexError. The program is summing 7-element windows, so the starting index i should only go up to n-7 inclusive. I fixed the range to 'range(n-6)', which iterates i = 0..n-7 and prevents out-of-range access.
fixed_code:
n = int(input())
s = list(map(int,input().split()))

for i in range(n-6):
  ans = 0
  for l in range(7):
    ans += s[l+i]

  print(str(ans),"",end = "")
